description: This course will provide students with an opportunity to consider the major spatial processes in 20th century Philadelphia history using historical maps, Geographic Information Systems (GIS), and spatial analysis techniques. Specific topics will include industry, immigration, segregation, housing, public transportation, and urban renewal. Students will learn to develop and test research questions as well as the foundations of Geographic Information Science. The instructor and students will collaborate to build an historical GIS around a particular theme. Class sessions will be organized as weekly seminars and will combine lecture, discussion, lab, and studio time.
name: TPCS IN MODERN EURO HIST: EUROPEAN VIEWS OF ISLAM
